articles.title: New equipment to slash open‐heart surgery backlog
articles.description: Rumbidzayi Zinyuke Senior Health Reporter ZIMBABWE is poised to significantly reduce its open-heart surgery backlog following the installation of a state-of-the-art heart-lung machine at Parirenyatwa Group of Hospitals, bringing relief...The post New equipment to slash open‐heart surgery backlog appeared first on herald.

articles.title: Zimbabwe doctors perform landmark open-heart surgery
articles.description: Doctors at Parirenyatwa Group of Hospitals have successfully carried out an open-heart surgery using a newly acquired heart-lung machine for the first time, marking a significant boost to Zimbabwe’s public cardiac care capacity. The milestone procedure was conducted on Tuesday in Harare as the hospital commissioned the state-of-the-art bypass machine, procured by the Government. Before [...]The post Zimbabwe doctors perform landmark open-heart surgery appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

articles.title: Govt Releases US$4.5m to Avert Rainy Season Disease Surge
articles.description: By Kudzaishe Chimonera Cabinet has warned of heightened risks of waterborne disease outbreaks during the current rainy season approving emergency measures to strengthen preparedness and prevent a national health crisis. Speaking during a post cabinet press briefing, Information Minister Zhemu Soda said Cabinet had received [...]The post Govt Releases US$4.5m to Avert Rainy Season Disease Surge appeared first on 263Chat.

articles.title: Zimbabwe Launches First Parenting App in Africa to Support Child Health
articles.description: Zimbabwe Launches First Parenting App in Africa to Support Child Health Zimbabwe has taken a continental lead in early childhood development after launching Africa’s first nationally adopted parenting mobile application aimed at supporting families with expert-backed childcare guidance. The Ministry of Health and Child Care officially unveiled the parenting application, Rera Umntwana — translated as [...]The post Zimbabwe Launches First Parenting App in Africa to Support Child Health first appeared on The Zambian Observer.
